meanings.sent1: She is bourgeoisifying her lifestyle by buying expensive designer clothes.
meanings.sent2: The family is slowly bourgeoisifying as they move into a wealthier neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The cat is bourgeoisifying its behavior by only drinking from a crystal bowl.
meanings.sent4: The city was slowly bourgeoisifying, with fancy cafes popping up on every corner.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work subtly hinted at the process of bourgeoisifying society.

meanings.definition: To adopt the characteristics or values of the bourgeoisie.
meanings.sent1: He is bourgeoisifying his speech by using fancy words he doesn't understand.
meanings.sent2: The young entrepreneur is quickly bourgeoisifying as he starts to value material possessions over everything else.
meanings.sent3: The dog seems to be bourgeoisifying as it refuses to eat anything other than gourmet dog food.
meanings.sent4: The small town was slowly bourgeoisifying, with luxury cars becoming a common sight.
meanings.sent5: The novel's protagonist was slowly bourgeoisifying, mirroring the societal changes around him.
